title: Yaya Toure offered Man City contract hope by Pep Guardiola
text:
Sport Yaya Toure offered Man City contract hope by Pep Guardiola Yaya Toure is out of contract at the end of the season, but has resurrected his Manchester City career under Pep Guardiola Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get Manchester City FC   
Pep Guardiola has provided Yaya Toure with fresh hope that he could yet land a new deal at Manchester City after hailing the Ivorian’s attitude. 
Toure has resurrected his Etihad career after being frozen out by Guardiola earlier in the season. 
The 33-year-old has become a mainstay in the team since his recall in November, with six goals in 15 appearances. 
And he was named ahead of Guardiola-favourite Fernandinho for Wednesday’s 4-0 win against West Ham. 
Despite his advancing years, Guardiola insists Toure still has the appetite and fitness to continue producing for City. 
“I spoke about the quality of Yaya, there is no doubt about that,” said the City manager. “Since I arrived here I said many, many times, so I’m delighted about his performance. 
“Yaya has a quality that is difficult to find today. 
“He loves football, he loves to play - he’s like an amateur. 
“He comes here to enjoy, always wants to train, always wants the ball, always wants to play. I love that. Toure was on the score sheet against West Ham 
“I like to play with guys like him. At the end it becomes a profession and you have to do that, but he is like an amateur in those terms. 
“He is really fit, the weight is perfect and the situation with Fernandinho and losing a lot of players meant he was so important for his personality and he helps us with his build-up and so on.” 
Toure was exiled from City’s first team after his controversial agent Dmitry Seluk publicly criticised Guardiola. 
But the midfielder’s subsequent apology saw him recalled for November’s 2-1 win against Crystal Palace, with Toure scoring both goals. 
Despite interest from China, Toure has opted to see out his contract at City, before assessing his future. Toure is out of contract at the end of the season 
It’s been his long-held desire to stay in the Premier League - even if he is forced to leave the Etihad. 
But with Ilkay Gundogan likely to miss the start of next season, following knee ligament damage, a one-year extension for Toure could be a convenient short-term fix for City. 
Guardiola has refused to offer much in the way of indication that Toure could yet have a future at the club - but does plan to discuss the veteran’s position with City’s hierarchy. Read More
